"annotation": "A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."
column7: "We went to visit Khubbab after he had been cauterised seven times. He said
column8: 'Our Companions who came before us have gone and this world did not cause the
column9: loss. We have been struck by an affliction for which we find no place to put it down except the earth. If it were no that the Prophet
column10: may Allah bless him and grant him peace
column11: forbade us to pray for death

"medical_condition": The Prophet (S.A.W) cauterized As'ad bin Zurarah for Shawkah

"A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."

"medical_condition": “Healing is in three things: A drink of honey
"annotation": the glass of the cupper
"hadeeth": but I forbid my nation to use cauterization.” And he attributed it to the Prophet (ﷺ)."

"annotation": "A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."
column6: "Jabir reported that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent a phystian to Ubayy b. Ka'b. He cut the vein and then cauterized it"

"annotation": "A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."
column6: "Jabir b. 'Abdillah reported that on the day of Ahzab Ubayy received the wound of an arrow in his medial arm vein. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cauterised it."

"annotation": "A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."
column6: "Jabir reported that Sa'd b. Mu'adh received a wound of the arrow in his vein. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cauterised it with a rod and it was swollen
column7: to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did it for the second time."

"annotation": "A general symptom that is characterized as an act
"hadeeth": or result of being bled or the process by which something is bled: as a the escape of blood from vessels."

"annotation": "If there is any healing in your medicines
"hadeeth": a gulp of honey or branding with fire (cauterization) that suits the ailment
"Modern_Treatment": but I don't like to be (cauterized) branded with fire.""
